CatDescriptText: Miss Mary Louise Pope, 2425 24th St. North, Birmingham, Ala., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 16, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that Negroes are giving sufficient financial help to the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People?" answer reads: "Where I'm living they don't and the reason is that most of the people are out of a job."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Louise Pope, wearing dress comprised of light colored skirt with horizontal bands of flowers and geometric patterns, dark sleeveless button down bodice with collar and horizontal bands of geometric patterns, and ribbon tie at waist, standing against light colored wall, with glass double doors, buildings, and pedestrians in background
